Welcome to the last week of Team Management. Please note that all outstanding course deliverables, which are listed below, must be completed before the course closes on Tuesday, January 24 at 11pm GMT.

  1. Final assessment: Complete the final assessment in Lesson 7 before course closure. Please note that you must complete the assessment by this deadline, as we cannot accept late submissions once the course has closed. The final assessment is required to pass the course.
  2. End-of-course survey: Complete the end-of-course survey before course closure. You can access the survey through this link; the survey should take no longer than 10 minutes to complete.

Course completion

As a reminder, participants need to 1) complete all graded items, and 2) score a proficiency of 70% or higher to pass the course to pass the course. Your proficiency is calculated in accordance with the following weights:

  • Plan a coaching session group work (50%)
  • Mid-course assessment (25%)
  • Final assessment (25%)

You may view a detailed breakdown of your course proficiency by going to your Progress page.

Feedback and coaching are focused on the needs of individual team members. In Lesson 6, we’ll return to the topic of managing groups. You'll take a brief quiz to assess your team's dynamics, and Michiel Kruyt will describe techniques for managing issues that commonly arise in teams.

Suggested activities: Jan 10-16

  1. Complete Lessons: The order of the phoenix
  2. If you haven't already, meet with your group to prepare for your group work activity.

In the news

The focus of this week's lesson is team dynamics. For an interesting read on this topic, check out Rich Fernandez’s article, "Help Your Team Manage Stress, Anxiety, and Burnout." Fernandez’s points dovetail nicely with those made by expert Michiel Kruyt in Lesson 6.
